content: Singaporean politician (1930–2014) **Mohamed Ariff Suradi** (1930 – 25 February 2014) was a Singaporean politician who had served as a four-term Member of Parliament representing [Ulu Pandan](/wiki/Ulu_Pandan_Single_Member_Constituency) from 1959-1963 and [Kampong Kembangan](/wiki/Kampong_Kembangan_Constituency) from 1963-1976. He was a member of the [People's Action Party](/wiki/People%27s_Action_Party). Suradi died on 25 February 2014, at the age of 73–74. ## Education Mohamed Ariff attended [Victoria School](/wiki/Victoria_School). This article about a politician from Singapore is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Mohamed Ariff Suradi
